WRITING.TEXT: Yep.

I don't know if he'd be interested in something as far removed from reality as the [US redrawn as 50 states of equal population](http://fakeisthenewreal.org/reform/), but it's still the real world,it's certainly interesting and it's one of my favorites. I've had it for over a year now and still find myself taking time to stop at the wall and examine it, and it's been a cool conversation starter.
Uh yeah, that's what I was doing until you had to interview me for your book about lights.
That's fair, and you're far from alone. There's an entire world of an industry with you...it's just an interesting phenomenon when I step back and analyze the situation.
I invest a lot of consideration into what random strangers that I'll never see again might think if they happened to catch a glimpse of white ankle as my jeans shifted during walking.

Whoa. I fell in love with New Balances in high school and bought the same model 3 times again when they'd wear out enough. I just want comfortable shoes, I'm not trying to wow anyone, and I knew what had worked well in the past. And just last fall when I was looking for new shoes, I found the Skechers store and their memory foam offerings and fell in love again.
I felt like having some more options, so I picked up yet another new pair of New Balances(a new model though!) over the Black Friday weekend. They feel very form fitting and I think they'll be as comfortable as my old NBs, but I'm like you really, it's hard to go back to anything else after having the memory foam soles. I probably would've grabbed another set of Skechers if they had been on sale instead.
Simmer down, this is just a database of stars and their distance from earth, no one is selling you anything.
That is from the September 25, 2012. Always loved Darren's hilarious description of old Bat Face.

After decades of being able to go, "I think I'll play a game" and 30 seconds later you are playing that game, it's just an annoying thing that gamers didn't have to deal with before. There's a workaround, absolutely, but it's something that didn't before, and still really doesn't, need to be worked around.
Like others have said, it's not like the game..or jesus, applications like Netflix or Hulu...are(in most cases) completely broken without these urgent updates. You should be able to choose to skip the update at that exact moment if you'd like.

Presumably, often you may not know you have that small window of time to play until you stumble upon that small window of time, or it may be something done on a whim. Not something you've scheduled in your planner a week ahead.
Moving to Reddit from other message boards has been an adjustment, that's for sure. I still occasionally expect threads to get bumped out of obscurity when I post hours later.
Probably just because a boulevard is traditionally the most "beautiful" type of roadway, so why not use it in a memorial situation.
There's hardly ever the need to open a pickle jar in the middle of a game.
A movie that didn't do phenomenally in theaters. There are plenty of *good* Stephen King movies, for sure.

I thought it was Pennsylvania Dutch, it sounds like a more formal, proto-Philladelphia accent to me.
Baltimore's might be very similar of course, I don't have a frame of reference like I do for a Philly accent.

Wow, as a fan I guys this is a good thing though it does feel a bit excessive. I certainly can't imagine it being good business-wise. When's the last time a Stephen King movie was a blockbuster? Ever? The Stand isn't going to do Twilight or Hunger Games numbers. So what are the chances the projects gets shot down after, like, movie 2? I don't think as much would be spent, or it's expected to do as well as those series, but clearly they're hoping to capture some of that magic and spread a big box office across for films...and I'm afraid they're going to get a disappointing surprise.
But then the market will fall out of the Minor Mistake Marvin meme.
Brought to you by Cliff Bar.
I can't wait to have it hanging on the wall and getting lost in there.
I like it, I probably would've put Mycroft or even Mrs. Hudson or Lestrade in there over Irene though.

I could be victim of this just with myself sometimes, I'd think I shouldn't complain because I didn't have it as bad as others. But what really turned me around on that aspect of it was reading the idea of "Not being sad because someone's had a worse day is just like not being happy because someone had a better day."
No one ever does that, no one ever dismisses all of your personal happy moments just because some millionaire out there is flying somewhere on his private jet with his supermodel girlfriend...so why should negative feelings be treated like that?
I hate any version of the "Your thing isn't the worst possible thing so you can't be sad/angry/worried about it". It's idiotic.
Why are those things seemingly at odds with each other, in your opinion?
That's good to hear. I've wanted to catch up, I'm just not nearly as motivated to listen immediately like I was several months ago. But this is encouraging.

This is what I've thought too. It's not like some law of nature, like a comet returning every (X) number of years. It's not something in control of an impartial third party. I'm excited and looking forward to the date, but there's really no reason to expect total disclosure when there's nothing keeping them from tucking anything truly explosive away forever.

Big agreement from me too. I haven't listened to the last..3,4...maybe 5 episodes, it just doesn't feel the same at all. It feels like a property that's been taken over by another creative team that can only try to imitate the original. It's hard to believe that what the show is currently was something always in the writers' minds at the beginning, and not largely a response to the, oddly immense, Tumblr following and obsession with only the "shipping" aspect of any show/movie/book/whatever.
Thins always evolve, for sure, but listening to the early episodes I never would have thought it was the kind of show that if eventually given the live theater treatment would have the audience whooping and awwing.
I liked when it felt more mysterious and yeah, a bit scary and disturbing. I liked when Cecil felt like a genuine radio personality and not an actor playacting the current stories. When he seemed a simple, faceless reporter of the news. I liked when every recurring character didn't make actual appearances on the show.
Utah cracked me up, the pinpoints are basically right and then they just said, "Fuck it, label 'em whatever."
The store in my area did the same thing, I was quite confused. Did they think no one had an internet? Or a TV?
It seems odd to commit to painting your body, but not better match the simple outfit.
More like Saturday Night Dead, amirite!?
Nah, long lost Avett brothers.
Great! Yes, please, on pictures.

This is awesome, fantastic work. I'm one of those who loves seeing in detail how things are made, so thanks for all the step-by-steps.
Are you going to be Finn? :D
John James Audubon. My first thought was Robin Williams as well, ha.
This was really good,thanks for making this and exposing me to someone I'd not heard of before. Definitely a Danny Elfman vibe to his work and voice. I'm going to have to check out his albums.
You'd think after, at least, ten years of seeing the show in action, he'd understand how to perform and present jokes like a human being.

As far as workarounds go, it's not a bad one. You could pretty quickly create a Comedy playlist, an Action Movie playlist, Documentaries, Cartoons, Horror...etc, etc. And shuffle whatever "channel" you were in the mood for. For everyone who grew up with TV, there is something ingrained in us about finding some joy in the that unpredictability.

You can make a playlist and shuffle its contents, but that's not quite the same. It would be a cool feature to have though. This is one of the reasons why I still like using XBMC(with Pseudo TV) occasionally

Wow, I hadn't heard about this being made, the book by Nathaniel Philbrick was amazing, I hope the movie comes close to doing it a tiny bit of justice.
Cool poster, very ominous.

Yeah, this is very strange, like have they stood back and actually thought about(I already know the answer..just rhetorical) what agenda would be under fire by decanonizing Columbus? And they talk about destroying tradition! Oh yes, all those memories of sitting around the Columbus Tree listening to Grandpa tell stories of Columbus Days of old. Family members from all states converging to exchange Columbus presents and watch the glut of Columbus specials on TV, I've always been partial to the Rankin-Bass one.
I had to stop at #10..I just couldn't take anymore. Of all the things to get so passionate about, a useless holiday most notably used today for spotlighting furniture sales.
She really downplayed it, that's a fucking hilarious story.

Welcome Freshmen on Nickelodeon, it never seems to be remembered as well as its contemporaries like Salute Your Shorts and Hey Dude and Clarissa Explains it All but I remember it feeling just as strong.

Yeah, I get that, but they could make a large wooden hamburger cutout for the storefront to accomplish that just as easily and make it look like something you'd actually see in reality.

That's something I've always hated, the design of the booths was far too fanciful and goofy. I'm sure there are plenty of hamburger shaped hamburger shops around..but they aren't the norm. These aren't tooooo bad, except for the SciFi entrances.
They aren't, haven't been like this in a long time. Now they're just uninspired, license-slathered buckets with a cardboard lid.

I bought the album this morning, I really enjoyed the samples last night. Great stuff, I really admire the sentiment, the world desperately needs more original Halloween songs.
One question, the album is called Halloween Haunts Revisited, seems to imply this is a sequel of sorts? Is there an earlier Halloween Haunts album?
Or they're poking fun at the silly, fearful overreactions going on these days about gluten.

[They're all by a fellow named Rado Javor](http://radojavor.deviantart.com/gallery/8353474/Halloween). He's made a couple new illustrations every October for the last few years. One of the things I always look forward to every season. No real story connecting them, he just loves the colonial American atmosphere.

Right, when the context is possessive there is no apostrophe.

Haha, good video. This is what really repels me from embracing the show as much as I used to. Ultimately, it boils down to being a teen soap opera with supernatural window dressing. That's not necessarily a bad thing, it's been a teen soap opera from the beginning, but lately it's starting to betray its own rules and shun the supernatural side i nthe name of teen soap opera-ness. I've always especially hated how the Originals are treated. They're mostly all shitheads, but whine seemingly oblivious about not being accepted and because Klaus and Rebecca are cute they overcome the baggage of ya know killing hundreds (some close to the main characters) of people in cold blood and characters aren't as bothered.
Ahh yes, that would be it. Thanks very much!

I was just thinking yesterday as I caught up on the last bit of season 39, trying to remember who overlapped with Andy Samberg, that a graphic like this would be great and I was imagining that I'd actually seen something like it somewhere online. What I was picturing was formatted a bit differently, the seasons were on the X-axis and the cast members ran down the Y and the chart was just a grid with colors filled in to show each performer's tenure. Not as informative as this, for sure, but a bit quicker at a glance to see who starred with who. Did I make this up in my mind or does anyone else know what I'm talking about?
Amazing work on this!

I just watched the John Dimaggio's documentary ["I Know That Voice"](http://www.netflix.com/WiMovie/80008579?trkid=13752289) last week. I've always been fascinated with voice acting and this was a really fun, much more insightful look than you typically get to hear on behind-the-scenes featurettes and the like.
For anything save maybe an animated series. If some of the biggest producers in Hollywood can't make it work even with a combo tv series/movie approach...I think it's not going to happen.
That's an odd name. I'd have called them "chazzwazzers".

The main problem would be their story is confined by reality. They chose to swim in semi-historical waters and are therefore somewhat beholden to honoring what actually happened. A prohibition story would naturally be structured around the period before the amendment was repealed, they couldn't just push that ahead a few years to suit a 5-season plan.
Oh, good call. That one had slipped my mind.
I'll be optimistic, but this isn't much of a ringing endorsement. I think King has been excited about all the movie/tv projects except Kubrick's Shining...ya know, the best one.

Indeed. I really think finding the right photo is the most important step of the trick. You have to find a photo where the angle and composition looks like it could be of a miniature setting to help fuel the illusion and fool the brain.

Jesus, no police set aside their work to screw around on this project. There wasn't shelves of "cold case evidence" just waiting to be tested and these jerks jumped the line with their Jack the Ripper shawl.

That's good to hear, I've been tempted to pick up some Adventure Time stuff but have been turned away by Jazzwares. Pretty much everything they've made for the last few years has been reviewed poorly for having thick sloppy paint(on items that should be on the easier side as far as paint schemes), awful seam lines on characters that by their nature are less forgiving to such ugliness, and weird or useless articulation that makes them prone to breaking.
They're from Jazwares, so they'll with 98% certainty be garbage, so if that's any consolation.

I think, as unhelpful as it might sound, is just to keep using it as much as possible, even just to navigate the OS. I remember for the first few months, feeling coordinated, just learning how to draw without the "paper" and the utensil being connected, was a huge challenge. I think that's the first big hurdle for most folks, get used to that feeling and your muscle memory will set in and your arm and hand will naturally know the nuances to create a broad stroke or light line just like you would do with a pencil on paper.

Yeah, I'd say still quite the accomplishment, I've not used the Wii U program but I've messed around with an art program on the DS and it was tricky. I'm far too used to having pressure sensitivity with my Wacom tablet on the computer, having to adjust my strategy without that pressure input has always been a big obstacle.
Still the gamepad and stylus, but more tools and flexibility in Sketchpad than the simple black and white pen drawings typically seen in the Miiverse.
Is all other music, movies, books, plays, art *not* intended to be liked? I didn't realize.

I listened to the station for a couple hours today and really enjoyed it, I love the variety. Just when you get a bit bored of a silly novelty song, a creepy soundtrack cut comes along, or something metal...always keeps you on your toes. This will be great to enhance my already expansive Halloween listening library.

I was a little unsure, when you click on individual items, the countdown timer says "Live online auction starts..." on September 27th. I didn't really understand what was going on now with bidding if the auction hadn't started yet.

Very cool! I remember jealously watching the auction back in 2010. Looks like there's some cool things that might be within reach, but that might change in the next few weeks before the auction starts.

I mean, sure, I understand that not every given game engine could do anything. But the way they talk it's like they found some mysterious, dusty engine on the street and are helpless as to how it works. As if they, ya know, weren't the ones behind it and didn't at all understand what requirements The Sims would have.

I'm not a programmer, but I don't understand how an engine could simply, flatly, for all eternity never allow certain features. And SimCity 2013 was also impossible to be played offline according to EA, so I take the statement with a shaker full of salt. It sounds exactly like non-sense they use to fool the more casual players so they can miraculously spring things like pools on those players in future expansions.
I only became aware of this this past weekend It looks interesting, even if it looks an awful lot like a copy-cat...it's still a theme park game and so I'm curious. I'll be keeping an eye on this.
It looks great, absolutely agreed.

Yeah, I don't mean to discount his work just cause it's on the more boring, technical side right now. I guess my comment's intent is mostly that there are still years to go and plenty of time for it to get overwhelming and him to abandon the project. Or there's still years to go and I have plenty of other things to keep myself occupied with besides waiting for updates on FreeRCT. I'm just leery of getting invested and hyped up by even AAA-projects when they are years out, that doesn't really ever turn out well, even if the game is well made.

Right, exactly, so I'm not going to be champing at the bit for it to come out next year. It seems far from close to completion to me. He's made amazing progress..is it just one guy? At the most it's a very small team. And so I'm amazed they've kept motivated after so long, but at this point they still have, if nothing else, thousands and thousands of pieces of art to make.

I'll check back in three years when there might be actual progress beyond shops and paths. Kudos to these guys, I've always been a fan of the original game's look and thought an HD upgrade would be great to see...but I'm not going to start salivating yet.

The artist made two maps, this is the more zoomed out scale. [The closer, more detailed map has the dog park and lots of specific locations.](http://cryingmanlytears.tumblr.com/post/56076745790/okay-so-i-could-not-find-any-sort-of-map-or)

[A buddy made this a couple years back](http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-EUVe-RZy5Xg/UZ5AGIajOII/AAAAAAAACAk/i9NC-SJ-FRc/s1600/Stephen+King+Map+of+Book+Connections.jpg) and I've always loved how attrative, clean and functional it was. It only focuses only on works that tie back into the Dark Tower, so maybe not as comprehensive as tessiegirl's chart, but still very awesome.
Presumably named in honor of the Native American tribe.

I watched live, but I was also pretty entrenched in forum discussions and so there was always the danger of some jackass thinking it would be hilarious to post done rumors or set photos unsolicited to spoil try to spoil everyone. I managed to not get really barraged with spoilers, but the worst thing that happened was probably when someone posted blurry on set photos of Sawyer in a Dharma jumpsuit weeks or maybe even a couple months before that was revealed on the show.

Whoops, I accidentally linked to the version that's a few days old. Here's the most recent version.

Thanks everyone, it's been a dream project ever since I got into the show and realized Newbridge was a Springfield-ian level crazy place. Whenever it's done, one way or another, posters will be made.

For any fans who don't frequent the Friends of Tom boards, here is the map of Newbridge I've been working on for a couple months now. I've talked a bit about it over there, but always happy to talk more and answer any queries people might have about it. It's been a fun project, still slowly chipping away at it. Hopefully have it finished in another month or so maybe.
